property.description: Defines the maximum size of long file names supported by FileX. The default value is 33. The minimum value is 13 and the maximum value is 256.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than or equal to 13 and less than or equal to 256, or empty

property.description: Defines the maximum size of long file names supported by FileX. The default value is 33. The minimum value is 13 and the maximum value is 256.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than or equal to 13 and less than or equal to 256, or empty

property.description: Defines the maximum number of logical sectors that can be cached by FileX. The cache memory supplied to FileX at fx_media_open determines how many sectors can actually be cached.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than 0 or empty

property.description: Defines the size in bytes of the bit map used to update the secondary FAT sectors. The larger the value the less unnecessary secondary FAT sector writes.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than 0 or empty

property.description: Defines the number of entries in the FAT cache.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than 0 or empty

property.description: Defines the number of seconds the time parameters are updated in FileX.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than 0 or empty

property.description: When enabled, FileX is built without update to the time parameters.
When enabled, FileX is running in a single-threaded environment and does not need thread protection.
When enabled, FileX does not update already opened files.
When disabled, the file search cache optimization is disabled.
When disabled, the direct read sector update of cache is disabled.
When disabled, gathering of media statistics is disabled.
When enabled, legacy single open logic for the same file is enabled.
When enabled, renaming inherits path information.
When enabled, local path logic is disabled.
When enabled, data sector write requests are flushed immediately to the driver.
When enabled, system sector write requests (including FAT and directory entry requests) are flushed immediately to the driver.
When enabled, 64-bits sector addresses are used in I/O driver.
When enabled, FileX fault tolerant service is enabled.

Define byte offset in boot sector where the cluster number of the Fault Tolerant Log file is. The default value is 116. Note that this field (byte 116 to 119) is marked as reserved by FAT 12/16/32/exFAT specification.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than or equal to 116 and less than or equal to 119

property.description: Define the requirement for minimal size of cluster in bytes. The default value is 3072. It must be multiple of sector size. When size of cluster is less than this value, fault tolerant feature does not work properly. The default value works with the worst case for long file name.

constraint.display: Value must be greater than or equal to 3072

config.content: #if (!${config.el.fx_src.error_checking}) #define FX_DISABLE_ERROR_CHECKING #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.max_long_name_len}+0) #define FX_MAX_LONG_NAME_LEN (${config.el.fx_src.max_long_name_len}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.max_last_name_len}+0) #define FX_MAX_LAST_NAME_LEN (${config.el.fx_src.max_last_name_len}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.max_sector_cache}+0) #define FX_MAX_SECTOR_CACHE (${config.el.fx_src.max_sector_cache}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.fat_map_size}+0) #define FX_FAT_MAP_SIZE (${config.el.fx_src.fat_map_size}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.max_fat_cache}+0) #define FX_MAX_FAT_CACHE (${config.el.fx_src.max_fat_cache}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.update_rate_in_seconds}+0) #define FX_UPDATE_RATE_IN_SECONDS (${config.el.fx_src.update_rate_in_seconds}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.no_timer}) #define FX_NO_TIMER #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.single_thread}) #define FX_SINGLE_THREAD #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.dont_update_open_files}) #define FX_DONT_UPDATE_OPEN_FILES #endif #if (!${config.el.fx_src.media_search_cache}) #define FX_MEDIA_DISABLE_SEARCH_CACHE #endif #if (!${config.el.fx_src.direct_data_read_cache_fill}) #define FX_DISABLE_DIRECT_DATA_READ_CACHE_FILL #endif #if (!${config.el.fx_src.media_statistics}) #define FX_MEDIA_STATISTICS_DISABLE #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.single_open_legacy}) #define FX_SINGLE_OPEN_LEGACY #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.rename_path_inherit}) #define FX_RENAME_PATH_INHERIT #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.no_local_path}) #define FX_NO_LOCAL_PATH #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant_data}) #define FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_DATA #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant}) #define FX_FAULT_TOLERANT #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.lba_64bit}) #define FX_DRIVER_USE_64BIT_LBA #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant_service}) #define FX_ENABLE_FAULT_TOLERANT #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant_boot_index}+0) #define FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_BOOT_INDEX (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant_boot_index}) #endif #if (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant_minimal_cluster}+0) #define FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_MINIMAL_CLUSTER (${config.el.fx_src.fault_tolerant_minimal_cluster}) #endif

constraint.display: Refer to release notes if multiple symbol definition linkage error occurs
